Find the solution of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
&x &+ &y &+ &z &= &0 \\ 
&-x &- &y &+ &2z &= &0 \\ 
&3x &- &y &- &5z &= &0
\end{cases}$$
answer3:
The system has infinitely many solutions depending on one parameter:
$$(3+z,2-2z,z),\, \forall z\in \mathbb{R}$$.
answer4:
The system has infinitely many solutions depending on two parameter:
$$(3+z+y,y,z),\, \forall y,z\in \mathbb{R}$$.

question:
Four workers ($W_1$, $W_2$, $W_3$ and $W_4$) should be selected to perform three different tasks ($T_1$, $T_2$ and $T_3$), for which they are unequally prepared. Based on the qualifications and previous experience, it was possible to construct the following table which indicates, for each worker $j$, the operation time in each task  $i$ (in weeks):

\[
\begin{array}{l|cccc|}
& W_1 & W_2 & W_3 & W_4\\
\hline
T_1 & 2 & 6 & 7 & 4 \\
T_2 & 9 & 8 & 4 & 2 \\
T_3 & 2 & 7 & 5 & 7 \\
\hline
\end{array}
\]	

What workers should be selected to carry out the tasks, in order to minimize the total time spent by them?
What can we say about the relative extrema of the function $f:(0,\infty) \times (0,\infty)\rightarrow \mathbb R$ given by $f(x,y)= x^2+xy+y^2-4\ln (x) -10\ln( y)+3$?
answer1: The point $M(2,1)$ is a relative minimizer.
answer2: The points $M(1,2)$ is a relative maximizer.
answer3: The point $M(2,1)$ is a relative maximizer.
answer4: The points $M(2,1)$ and $N(1,2)$ are relative minimizer and respectively, relative maximizer.

Find the solutions of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
x & - & y & + & 2z & - & 3t & = & 1 \\ 
2x & + & y & - & 2z & - & t & = & 2 \\ 
x &- &3y &+ &z &- &2t &= &-1 \\
  &   &      &     &z &- &t &= &0
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The system has $\left(5,\,1,\,3,\,3\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer3: The system has $\left(5+20y,\,y,\,-10-13y,\,8+15y\right)$ as solution for every $y\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer4: The system has $\left(5,0,-10,8\right)$ as its unique solution.

question:
Find  the points of local extremum for the function
$f(x,y,z)=\displaystyle{\dfrac{z^2}{9y}+\dfrac{6x^2}{z}+\dfrac{4}{x}+y}.$
answer1:
$\left(-1,-1,-3\right)$ is the point of maximum and
$\left(1,1,3\right)$ is the point of minimum.
answer2:
$\left(-1,1,-3\right)$ is the point of maximum and
$\left(1,-1,3\right)$ is the point of minimum.
answer3:
$\left(-1,-1,-3\right)$ is the point of minimum and
$\left(1,1,3\right)$ is the point of maximum.
answer4:
$\left(-1,1,-3\right)$ is the point of minimum and
$\left(1,-1,3\right)$ is the point of maximum.

The WorldLight Company produces two light fixtures (products $1$ and $2$) that require both metal frame parts and electrical components. Management wants to determine how many units of each product to produce so as to maximize profit. For each unit of product $1$, $1$ unit of frame parts and $2$ units of electrical components are required. For each unit of product $2$, $3$ units of frame parts and $2$ units of electrical components are required. The company has $200$ units of frame parts and $300$ units of electrical components. 

Each unit of product $1$ gives a profit of $1?$, and each unit of product $2$, up to $60$ units, gives a profit of $2?$. Any excess over	$60$ units of product $2$ brings no profit, so such excess has been ruled out.

A researcher studies the wind speed in a particular city. A sample of two hundred observations was recorded. The mean speed was calculated to be $10 m/s$ and the median speed was calculated to be $7 m/s$. Which of the following interpretations is correct?
answer1: $50\%$ of the sampled observations had speed that was less than or equal to $7 m/s$.
answer2: The most frequently occurring wind speed in the sample was $7 m/s$.
answer3: $50\%$ of the sampled observations had speed that was equal to $7 m/s$.
answer4: $50\%$ of the sampled observations had speed that was less than or equal to $10 m/s$.

Consider the matrix 
$$A_k=\left[\begin{array}{rrr}
 1  & 1  & 0 \\
  -1 & -k  & k-1 \\
  3 & 2  & 2k+1
\end{array}\right]$$
and denote by $L(A_k)$ the space of the rows of the matrix $A_k$. Which of the following statements is true?
answer1: If $k\in \mathbb{R}\backslash \{0, 1\}$ then the dimension of $L(A_k)$ is $3$
answer2: The dimension of $L(A_k)$ is $3$ for every $k\in \mathbb{R}$
answer3: If $k\in \mathbb{R}\backslash \{0\}$ then the dimension of $L(A_k)$ is $3$
answer4: If $k\in \mathbb{R}\backslash \{0, -1\}$ then the dimension of $L(A_k)$ is $3$

question: Let be the vectors $u=(2,1,1)$ and $v=(1, 2, -2)$ of $\mathbb{R}^3$. The cross product $u\times v$ is:

answer2: The vector $w=(-4,-5,3)$ parallel to $u$ and $v$, with norm $5\sqrt{2}$
answer3: A vector that is perpendicular to both $u$ and $v$, with norm $5$
answer4: A vector parallel to $u$ and $v$, with norm $5$
